channel.title: How does computer get the time?
channel.description:
Say you have no internet connection at all, and you shut down your computer for, say, several hours. When you turn it back on, still having no internet, it has the correct time.
How does your computer go about figuring out what time it is? Is it a internal component in the motherboard? If so, does that mean that the components really aren't idle?

item.title: How does computer get the time?
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Frell:

Can they seriously not put something like that in a fucking alarm clock?

Read full topic
item.source: How does computer get the time?

item.title: How does computer get the time?
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:20, topic:421174”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=523839.msg3815135#msg3815135 date=1321258119]
Some gameboy games (including Pokemon) have a battery backed clock+memory thing in the cart. The newer ones even did like a day night cycle thing so it was night ingame when you played at night, iirc?
[/quote]

Yup, I found this out last year when I found my old pokemon games and all the saves were gone. Was the most tragic day of my life.[/quote]

This happened to me a while back. Manly tears were shed. NO! FUCK THAT! I cried like a fucking baby.

Read full topic
item.source: How does computer get the time?

item.source: How does computer get the time?

item.title: How does computer get the time?
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:6, topic:421174”][quote author=DEFET link=topic=523839.msg3811519#msg3811519 date=1320973163]
Ahh I see. I read something similar to that, but I believed that would require power and eventually run out, which I thought made no logical sense.
So does that mean that this battery must be replaced after it eventually runs out?
[/quote]
it recharges once plugged in, iirc[/quote]
I don’t think they can be recharged. But anywho, if you pull the battery out to reset the BIOS a fair few times, the battery will drain out a lot faster in my opinion. Over the last 3 years I have had 2 batteries go flat in my desktop. I think they are re-chargeable on laptops however, since my old Dell Latitude L400 had a screwed battery in it and if you left the Laptop off for like a week it would take about 20 minutes before the computer would even to anything when you pressed the power button.

Read full topic
item.source: How does computer get the time?

item.title: How does computer get the time?
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

DEFET:

So does that mean that this battery must be replaced after it eventually runs out?

Yes, but that takes a very long time. I recently took two old pcs out of my attic, neither of which had been on for probably 7-10 years. One wouldn’t start because the battery was bad, the other started up just fine

Read full topic
